Well, if the rotifers really were frozen for 24000 years of course I would expect them to be genetically different from modern-day rotifers. They were frozen for 24000 years, they are probably from a species of rotifers we thought were extinct. Oh and just to let everyone know, C14 dating has of about 6000 years, but according all the sources I have read it can be used to date objects as old as 50000 years, after that the amount of C14 is too miniscule to be detected. So there is no problem with the science being used here.
